New Records: The Cavaliers extended their winning streak to 11, improved the league's best record to 32-4 — 11-0 against the West — and moved to 19-1 at home.
Key Match Events: Mobley then hit a 10-footer in the lane to put Cleveland up by five.
Mitchell was called for a loose ball foul with 1:19 left. The Cavs challenged and the call was reversed by replay review.
Pre-Game Insights: The matchup was only the third in history between teams riding double-digit winning streaks.
Post-Match Reflections: Thunder: Gilgeous-Alexander is the team's undisputed star, but Oklahoma City has some nice pieces.
Cavaliers: Cleveland showed its balance, depth and that it can get by when Mitchell isn't on.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Only four teams have posted a better record through 36 games than Cleveland: Golden State (34-2) in 2015-16, Philadelphia (33-3) in 1966-67, the Los Angeles Lakers (33-3) in 1971-72 and Chicago (33-3) in 1995-96.
Others: The last time it happened was on Jan. 26, 1995, when Seattle and Utah entered their game each on 10-game winning streaks.
